channel.title: Server problem
channel.description: Hey! i made my server all thing was ok, i logged in it was ok too...,now i tried to load up to serv status and it said its off and it says off now too... what ya think ,wat is the problem?help pl0x P.S.:if i start my runserver file it says veki-isle is online, i heard it has to say veki-isle is logged in from 0.0.043594 or w/e...maybe this is the problem? if it is post some runeserver codes pl0x ty,veki :( :o :|

item.title: Server problem
item.dc:creator: @p0unding p0unding
item.description:
@p0unding wrote:

-go to no i-p and put that up first
-now run server
-wait 5 mins
Now go to server status page and post it there.

make sure that the port and i-p is right.
If it still dosn’t work you need to change your i-p.
keep the port the same.

It should work, because when I first started my server
I had the same problem to. good luck

~p0unding~
owned of p0undingscape

Read full topic

veki94

heres what u do
where u said
P.S.:if i start my runserver file it says veki-isle is online, i heard it has to say veki-isle is logged in from 0.0.043594 or w/e…maybe this is the problem?
that’s ok
but if you wana fix that go into server.JAVA and look and type ctrl + f and type in the box veki-isle
when is comes up it should say something like sendmessage(veki-isle is logged in);
just put the code as
vekiisle is logged in on 0.0.0.43594

item.title: Server problem

item.description:
@veki94 wrote:

um…i downloaded that no-ip…offline…
about port forwarding my router is kinda um “intresting” because it doesnt have like e.x appliciations&games menu btw i did it like it wrote at portforward.com…still offline…im kinda angry…every tutorials i’ve red it said when u open the runserver file it has to say somethin like logging in from port 0.0.0.0.43594 , in mine runserver file it says e.x veki-isle online maybe its the problem…post plz good runserver codes or help…lol :mad: :mad:

item.title: Server problem
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

ok all your guys problems are you havn’t port forwarded (if you don’t have a router theres no port forwarding)
go to www.portforward.com for more information about your router. (just select it from a list) and then once you for port forward all you hav to do it go to www.no-ip.com and sign up, and add a host, then download no-ip and then run it, and use you host name as the ip address when you go to submit it.

good luck

Read full topic
